body:
Problem: The current implementation of `serverlist({ peer = true})` only checks the `stdpath('run')` of the calling neovim server. Since this is local to the server, `serverlist`, misses other servers.
Solution: Check one directory above the local `stdpath('run')` to find other servers that might have been missed.

Ref:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/35492
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34806#discussion_r2296987660

comment_data.body: This feels a bit hacky but it does work. However if `XDG_RUNTIME_DIR` is set (to something like `/run/user/1000`, I think ubuntu sets this by default), the server might not launch because of permissions. I'm unsure how exactly to tackle this.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -191,7 +191,16 @@ describe('server', function()
     if t.is_os('win') then
       return
     end
-    local peer_addr = n.new_pipename()
+    local peer_temp = n.new_pipename()
+
+    -- Find the last instance of '/' to extract the servername
+    local slash_ind = peer_temp:match(".*".."/".."()")
+    if slash_ind == nil then
+      slash_ind = 0
+    end
+    local peer_name = peer_temp:sub(slash_ind)
+    local peer_addr = vim.fs.normalize(fn.stdpath('run') .. '/..') .. '/' .. peer_name

comment_data.body: note that you can start the nvim instances with `n.clear{env={XDG_RUNTIME_DIR=...}}` (also works with `new_session`), that seems like the first step ?

comment_data.body:
there are probably better ways but in the worse case this could be
```suggestion
    local peer_addr = ('%s/../%s'):format(vim.fs.normalize(fn.stdpath('run')), peer_name)
```

format() is almost always better. `..` is clumsy.

comment_data.body:
why didn't the asserts change? we should assert that "greater than x" servers were found. one reason why the bug went unnoticed was because we weren't doing that. we should assert both case. the `peer=true` case should find more servers than the `peer=false` case.

and this should not require a lot of code.
